name: Grilled Fish Fillets with Greek Orzo Salad
description: Quickly grilled fish with lemon-oregano pairs with a fresh Greek-style orzo salad. Mild, bright, and family-friendly for a weeknight braai.
prep_steps: Preheat the OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat.
Bring a medium pot of water to a boil on the stove for the orzo.
Pat dry fish fillets with paper towels.
Halve the lemon; zest one half and juice both halves into a small bowl.
Slice cucumber into half-moons; halve cherry tomatoes; thinly slice red onion.
Rinse olives and crumble feta cheese.
In a cup, whisk olive oil, vinegar, a pinch of salt, black pepper, lemon zest, and a pinch of oregano for the salad dressing.
cook_steps: Cook orzo in boiling water until al dente (about 8–10 minutes). Drain, rinse under cool water, and shake dry.
Toss cooled orzo with cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, olives, feta cheese, and half of the dressing. Set aside.
Rub fish fillets with olive oil, a squeeze of lemon juice, salt, black pepper, and oregano.
Oil grill grates. Grill fish 2–4 minutes per side (thickness-dependent) until opaque and flakes easily.
Plate fish. Drizzle a little of the remaining dressing over the fish and the rest over the orzo if needed.
Serve immediately with extra lemon wedges (from the grilled lemon halves if desired).
